oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from J. W. Hunter to Mrs. Nannie Beale
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Envelope is addressed to Nannie Beale, Sick Creek, Tenn., and bears a 5-cent Jefferson Davis CSA stamp; it is postmarked Nashville. Letter is dated Dec. 20, 1861. J. W. Hunter addresses Nannie as "My Dear Sister Beale," and writes that he was deeply afflicted by the loss of Bro. Beale. He goes on, "O, this sad, miserable, war how many hearts be crushed by it; how many homes will be rendered desolate. I do not, I cannot understand it; but God is his own interpreter and he will make it plain."
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
